intro: Stylidium alsinoides, commonly known as the false alsike, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that are often borne on short pedicels. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Stylidium alsinoides is a perennial herb that exhibits a unique flowering pattern, with flowers opening sequentially along the stem.
